intro: Silene qiyunshanensis, commonly known as the Qiyunshan catchfly, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy areas at high altitudes. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Silene qiyunshanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
